programme.title: 2025 NCAA Women's College World Series
programme.desc: No. 12 seed Texas Tech (53-12) eliminated four-time defending champion and No. 2 seed Oklahoma, 3-2, in Game 13; No. 6 seed Texas (54-12) advanced to its third championship series in four seasons after defeating No. 7 seed Tennessee, 2-0, in Game 11.

programme.title: Cornhole
programme.desc: The world's top-ranked cornhole players finish out the the ACL Signature #2 and Open #13 at the Arizona Athletic Grounds in Mesa, Arizona for a combined $50,000 in prize money; ACL Pro Teams contest a set of regular season matches.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: As Michael Jordan's fame peaked to unparalleled levels in the early 1990s in the wake of consecutive NBA titles and a starring role on the Olympic Dream Team, his image as "Air Jordan" made him a profoundly significant cultural figure.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title throughout the 1990s.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: Once a key member of the hated Detroit Pistons "Bad Boys" championship teams that brutalized Michael Jordan, Dennis Rodman is virtually all Jordan can count on in the early months of the 1997-98 season as a key defender and rebounder.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: South Carolina baseball coach Ray Tanner made it a point for the players to visit a children's hospital each season, as the players during the 2010 and 2011 national title seasons formed a bond with two special kids undergoing cancer treatment.

programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Miami (Fla.) (34-25) has won seven of the past 10 meetings, including an 8-5 victory in the 2024 ACC Tournament; Louisville (38-21) advanced out of the Nashville Regional after wins over East Tennessee State, No. 1 Vanderbilt and Wright State.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: Top Rank Boxing on ESPN
programme.desc: Started in 1973 by Bob Arum and Jabir Herbert Muhammad, Top Rank Boxing showcases some of the biggest names in the sport as one of the premier promoters, as fighters move up the rankings in their weight classes to earn a title bout.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 9 seed Florida State (41-14), which makes its 19th all-time Super Regional appearance, won the Tallahassee Regional last weekend; No. 8 seed Oregon State (45-13-1) won the Corvallis Regional by outscoring its opponents, 54-12, in five games.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Arizona (42-18), which has won the Pac-12 (2024) and the Big 12 (2025) Tournaments in back-to-back seasons, is 3-2 all-time vs. the Tar Heels; No. 5 seed North Carolina (45-13) won the Chapel Hill Regional with a 14-4 triumph over Oklahoma on June 2.

programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title throughout the 1990s.

programme.title: Squeeze Play
programme.desc: Whip-around coverage of the NCAA Baseball Championships, as 64 teams play in 16 regionals around the country with the winners advancing to the Super Regionals.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 4 seed Auburn, which hosts a Super Regional for the first time in team history, seeks its fifth College World Series title; Coastal Carolina, which won a national title in its lone CWS appearance in 2016, ranks second nationally with a 3.22 ERA.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: Coastal Carolina (51-11) looks to return to Omaha, Neb. for the first time since winning its maiden College World Series title in its debut appearance in 2016; No. 4 seed Auburn (41-18) won the inaugural meeting in the 2019 Atlanta Regional, 16-7.

programme.title: Sport Fishing TV
programme.desc: Sport Fishing magazine's executive editor, award-winning marine journalist and host John Brownlee goes to exotic locations around the world to showcase abundant fisheries during their peak seasons and focusing on specific species.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In the fall of 1997, Michael Jordan and the Chicago Bulls begin their quest to win a sixth NBA title in eight years, but "The Last Dance," as coach Phil Jackson called it, will be shadowed by tension with the club's front office.

programme.title: The Art of Ward: Keyshawn Davis
programme.desc: Andre Ward breaks down Keyshawn Davis before he defends his WBO World lightweight title against Edwin De Los Santos on June 7, and sits down with longtime friend and WBC lightweight champion Shakur Stevenson to get his thoughts on Davis.

programme.title: College Baseball
programme.desc: No. 5 seed North Carolina, which earned runner-up finishes in back-to-back seasons in 2006-07, won the Chapel Hill Super Regional last season; Arizona, a four-time winner of the College World Series, seeks its 19th appearance in Omaha, Neb.

programme.title: Full Court Press
programme.desc: The accomplishments and achievements of Iowa's Caitlin Clark, South Carolina's Kamilla Cardoso and UCLA's Kiki Rice are chronicled as they go through the 2023-24 season, showcasing the memorable moments and record-breaking performances.

programme.title: Banana Ball
programme.desc: The Savannah Bananas, an independent baseball team, bring their unique and entertaining style of the sport to the field as they take on other teams; they embark on their annual world tour, visiting different cities in the United States and beyond.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview UFC 316 and the main event as Merab Dvalishvili (19-4) defends his bantamweight title against Sean O'Malley (18-2); other bouts include: Julianna Pena (13-5) defending her bantamweight title against Kayla Harrison (18-1).

programme.title: Sportsman's Adventures with Captain Rick Murphy
programme.desc: Captain Rick Murphy, the all-time winningest saltwater tournament angler in the United States, who boats 139 titles to date, goes fishing with a wide variety of passionate anglers in a multitude of thriving fishing holes.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Spain claimed a 2-1 victory against France in the semi-finals round of 2024's Euro tournament with goals scored by Lamine Yamal and Dani Olmo after going down, 1-0; Randal Kolo Muani found the net for France in the 10th minute of play.

programme.title: IndyCar: Anything to Win
programme.desc: Interviews with drivers, legends and celebrities give an in-depth perspective at the magnitude of one of the most prestigious races, the Indianapolis 500, what the drivers are willing to risk for the checkered flag and the emotion of winning.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Germany claimed a 4-2 win over Portugal in their most recent meeting from the group stage of the 2021 Euro where Germany's Robin Gosens had a goal and an assist; Cristiano Ronaldo and Diogo Jota both had a goal and assist for Portugal in the defeat.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Spain claimed a 2-1 victory against France in the semi-finals round of 2024's Euro tournament with goals scored by Lamine Yamal and Dani Olmo after going down, 1-0; Randal Kolo Muani found the net for France in the 10th minute of play.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Defending champion Birmingham (6-3) won three of its last four games after a 26-22 win over Michigan behind J'Mar Simth and Larry Rountree III; Memphis (2-7) defeated the Stallions, 24-20, on April 25 behind 235 passing yards from Dresser Winn.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Match Day
programme.desc: A thorough preview of the upcoming UEFA Nations League matchup, including in-depth analysis of strategy, key things to watch, exclusive interviews, predictions from experts, special features and a breakdown of each club's strengths and weaknesses.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Match Day
programme.desc: A thorough preview of the upcoming UEFA Nations League matchup, including in-depth analysis of strategy, key things to watch, exclusive interviews, predictions from experts, special features and a breakdown of each club's strengths and weaknesses.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: 100 Days to Indy
programme.desc: Chip Ganassi Racing secures a win, with Marcus Ericsson taking the top spot at St. Petersburg; the infamous Andretti Autosport, with seven-time champion Colton Herta in the lead, aim to return to form; Arrow McLaren fight to overtake their rivals.

programme.desc: St. Louis (7-2) won five-straight games after a 39-13 win over San Antonio behind Max Duggan and Brandon Silvers; DC (6-3) defeated the Battlehawks, 27-15, on April 13 behind 243 passing yards and three touchdowns from Jordan Ta'amu.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Spain claimed a 2-1 victory against France in the semi-finals round of 2024's Euro tournament with goals scored by Lamine Yamal and Dani Olmo after going down, 1-0; Randal Kolo Muani found the net for France in the 10th minute of play.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: UEFA Nations League Soccer
programme.desc: Germany claimed a 4-2 win over Portugal in their most recent meeting from the group stage of the 2021 Euro where Germany's Robin Gosens had a goal and an assist; Cristiano Ronaldo and Diogo Jota both had a goal and assist for Portugal in the defeat.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou continued his dominant start with his first Indianapolis 500 win of his career to increase his lead over Pato O'Ward to 112 points; Scott Dixon won the race at Detroit last year over Marcus Ericsson.

programme.desc: Tony Stewart leads Shawn Langdon in Top Fuel by three points, Austin Prock leads Jack Beckman in Funny Car by 51 points and Dallas Glenn leads Greg Anderson in Pro Stock by 11 points following Chicago, the sixth event of the 2025 season.

programme.title: Korn Ferry Tour Golf
programme.desc: The winner of the tournament earns $180,000 and receives 500 points towards the Korn Ferry Tour Points List; Belgium's Adrien Dumont de Chassart, who was making his Korn Ferry Tour, secured a playoff victory over Josh Teater in last year's edition.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $2.75 million purse, the most since it debuted in 1972, is the fourth of six events on the DP World Tour's European Swing; Guido Migliozzi outlasted Joe Dean and Marcus Kinhult in a playoff in last year's edition.

programme.desc: Tournament updates and the latest headlines from the world of golf with insightful commentary from journalists and golf professionals; coverage includes highlights, expert analysis, exclusive interviews, special features and roundtable discussions.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $9,800,000 purse, debuted in 1904 and was won by England's Jack Oke; Robert MacIntyre became the first Scotsman to win the event in 98 years with his one-shot victory over American Ben Griffin in last year's edition.
